alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 2:49PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Apache and Navajo Counties across Hopi and Navajo Nation tribal lands through 430 PM MDT/330 PM MST/... At 346 PM MDT/246 PM MST/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 14 miles southwest of First Mesa to 8 miles northeast of Seba Dalkai to near Tees Toh. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, heavy rainfall, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rainfall may result in minor flooding and impassible roads due to muddy conditions. Locations impacted include... Keams Canyon, Dilkon, Greasewood Springs, First Mesa, Castle Butte, Low Mountain, Toyei, Steamboat, White Cone, Steamboat Canyon, Jadito, Cedar Springs, Indian Wells, Jeddito, Navajo, Greasewood, Polacca and Hopi Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 384 and 427. State Route 87 near mile marker 371, and between mile markers 388 and 406. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. In addition, public reports indicate that landspouts are possible. Very minor damage cannot be ruled out with these features. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to minor flooding and muddy road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
